BHEL share price jumps over 4%. Why is the stock rising today?BHEL shares were trading at Rs 282.40, up Rs 10.10 or 3.71% as of 10:10 AM. The stock had closed at Rs 272.30 in the last session. It opened higher at Rs 279.10 and moved up further during the day..

Silver falls Rs 12,500, gold prices also easeInvestors remained cautious ahead of important global events, including expected US Supreme Court rulings on Trump-era tariffs and the release of US labour market data.

Bloodbath on Dalal Street: Sensex ends 780 points lower, Nifty falls below 26,000The Sensex closed 780 points lower, while the Nifty slipped under the psychologically important 26,000 level, reflecting growing investor caution amid mixed global cues and stock-specific pressure in frontline names. The fall was widespread, with most sectoral indices ending in negative territory.

entertainment.headline: Emraan Hashmi on viral cameo in The Ba***ds of Bollywood: Nothing changed for me Emraan Hashmi says the viral response to his cameo in The Ba**ds of Bollywood has not changed anything for him, as he prefers to stay detached from success and online hype.

The film is set to reach cinemas on February 13, 2026.

Haq vs Nikaah: Why 2025 film on triple talaq couldn't match 1982 hit's success Indian cinema has historically used storytelling to spotlight social issues, with classics like Nikaah successfully addressing triple talaq and women's rights. However, despite critical acclaim, the recent film Haq on the same subject failed to draw crowds to cinemas.

Meditative and grounded, it reflects on life, loss and the search for peace.

general news.headline: Live: Focus on your country, Iran's Khamenei tells Trump, warns protestersAnti-Khamenei Protests live updates: Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, on Friday said the Islamic Republic will not tolerate individuals acting as "mercenaries" for foreign powers, as unrest continues and tensions with Western countries remain high. Khamenei also took a swipe at former US President Donald Trump, telling him to focus on problems within his own country.

Mamata blocked ED raid, it was 3 officers vs dozens of cops: Sources on I-PAC raidWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee allegedly intervened during an Enforcement Directorate raid at Indian Political Action Committee premises, with sources claiming intimidation and pressure to alter records.

It's out there now. Trump taking it out on India as Modi didn't call, hurt his egoUS Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said the whole trade deal was set up, but for it to reach its conclusion, PM Modi needed to call Trump. That eventually did not happen.

The Leela, Udaipur fined Rs 10 lakh for privacy violation; guests were in bathroomA Chennai consumer court ordered The Leela Palace, Udaipur, to pay Rs 10 lakh compensation after holding the hotel guilty of privacy violation and service deficiency, following unlawful room entry by housekeeping staff.

When BCCI's Jogu Da helped Bangladesh cricket pass crucial TestFormer BCCI president and then ICC chief Jagmohan Dalmiya played a decisive role in Bangladesh becoming the 10th nation to gain Test status through a unanimous vote in June 2000. India strongly backed Bangladesh's case, and that support proved crucial.

Live: Judge leaves courtroom as chaos erupts during TMC vs ED hearing over I-PAC raidsED vs Mamata Banerjee Live Updates: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee will lead a protest rally at 2 pm today over the ED's raids on the political consultancy firm I-PAC and the residence of its director Pratik Jain in Kolkata. Apart from the protest, the Trinamool Congress vs ED faceoff will be seen at the Calcutta High Court, with the probe agency alleging interference during the searches. The raids were part of a money laundering probe into an alleged multi-crore rupee coal pilferage scam. Banerjee dramatically turned up at the residence of Jain and its office amid the ED raid, alleging that the central agency was attempting to seize the Trinamool Congress's internal documents ahead of Assembly polls, scheduled to be held in less than three months. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Not Gaza, my life for Iran: Anti-Khamenei protesters target bullseyeThe slogan "Neither Gaza nor Lebanon, my life for Iran" rang out in Iran's Asgharabad, where protesters lit fires and chanted through the night as anti-Khamenei demonstrations entered their 13th day on Friday. The slogan is a rejection of the Khamenei regime's foreign policy priorities and proxy wars amid domestic distress.

The ugly divorce battle of Zoho's Sridhar Vembu and a Rs 15,000 crore bondA US court has directed Zoho's Sridhar Vembu to post a $1.7 billion (Rs 15,278 crore) bond in the ongoing divorce case. It has brought into focus the high-stakes divorce battle between Vembu and his estranged wife, Pramila Srinivasan. Here is all about the case.

The Raja Saab review: Prabhas's horror comedy is devoid of charm, thrills and chillsRelease Date:Fri Jan 09, 2026The Raja Saab movie review: Director Maruthi's The Raja Saab, starring Prabhas, Sanjay Dutt and Nidhhi Agerwal, is a fantasy horror comedy that relies heavily on the lead actor. However, there's hardly anything that's redeemable in this soulless film.

The standoff has revived memories of a forgotten chapter from history — when Viking settlers from Greenland reached North America centuries before Columbus, triggering violent clashes that ended in retreat and shaped Greenland's enduring strategic importance.

sports.headline: Kenya tennis admits wildcard blunder after player's embarrassing defeat goes viral A first-round match at the ITF W35 Nairobi tournament has prompted public scrutiny and an official response from Tennis Kenya over the awarding of a wildcard to Egyptian player Hajar Abdelkader. Hajar managed to win only three points and lost 0-6, 0-6 in her professional tennis debut.

The Bangladesh Cricket Board has written to the International Cricket Council, urging it to move the team's matches out of India, citing security concerns.

Nick Kyrgios withdraws from Australian Open singles, set to compete in doubles Nick Kyrgios has announced he will not compete in the singles draw at the Australian Open. He will instead focus on doubles as he recovers from injuries and prepares for future tournaments.

Tata Steel Chess: Viswanathan Anand, Nihal Sarin share lead after six roundsViswanathan Anand and Nihal Sarin finished day two of the Tata Steel Chess India Rapid on top of the Open standings after six rounds, both accumulating 4.5 points. Atiqa Mir shines on junior S125 debut with historic top-five finish at Abu DhabiEleven-year-old Atiqa Mir delivered a stunning junior S125 debut, finishing fifth at Yas Marina to become the first Indian and first female to achieve a top-five finish on debut in IAME UAE history.

Smriti's message for youngsters in WPL: Performances can open doors to T20 World CupSmriti Mandhana said strong performances in the WPL can open doors to India selection, stressing that young players with standout seasons will be in contention for the Women's T20 World Cup.

Former Mizoram Ranji Trophy cricketer dies after collapsing during matchK Lalremruata, a former Mizoram Ranji Trophy cricketer, passed away after collapsing during a local tournament match, leading to the cancellation of all scheduled cricket matches as a mark of respect.

Pakistan Super League expands with Sialkot, Hyderabad sold for record pricesThe Pakistan Super League took a major step towards expansion on Thursday, with two new franchises sold at record prices at an auction on Thursday, confirming an eight-team league from the 11th edition onward.

Smith, Starc's BBL return: Sydney Sixers player jokes he may lose starting spotSydney Sixers star Joel Davies joked that he may be axed when Steve Smith and Mitchell Starc return to the team for the remainder of the Big Bash League 2026. Smith and Starc said that they will turn up for the Sixers after the Ashes win.

MP's Noor Ahmed? SRH new recruit Shivang Kumar spins a web in Vijay Hazare TrophyVijay Hazare Trophy: 23-year-old Shivang Kumar, playing for Madhya Pradesh, is impressing with his left-arm wrist-spin and big-hitting ability. On Thursday, the SunRisers Hyderabad new recruit picked up his maiden five-wicket haul in their win over Karnataka in Ahmedabad.

Harry Brook's nightclub incident doesn't surprise Vaughan: England have been looseMichael Vaughan said that he wasn't surprised to hear about Harry Brook's nightclub incident ahead of the New Zealand tour. Vaughan said that England have been loose both on and off the field in recent times after losing the Ashes 1-4.

Egyptian player's bizarre professional debut goes viralThe lopsided match at a Nairobi ITF tournament, featuring Egyptian wildcard Hajar Abdelkader, who won just three points, has sparked global debate over professional standards, wildcard scrutiny and competitive integrity in lower-tier tennis events.

No champagne showers: Australia give Khawaja final tribute during Ashes celebrationThere were no champagne showers during the Ashes trophy celebrations as the Australian team gave a perfect tribute to the retiring Usman Khawaja after the SCG Test on Thursday, January 8.

ICC Player of the Month: Shafali Verma named, no Indian shortlisted for men's awardYoung opener Shafali Verma is the only Indian cricketer nominated by the ICC for the Women's Player of the Month award for December 2025, with no Indian representation among the men's nominees.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
